deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2082-10-31
Team B Internal Medicine Intern Admission Note
Louise Urquhart
MR# 2072665
Date of Admission: 10/30/82
PCP: Dr. Tatyana Butler (Solemar Hospital)
ID/CC: 75 yo F with HTN, DM2, RCC s/p right radical nephrectomy 2079 presents with hypertensive urgency
HPI: Has h/o HTN, saw her PCP in September, BP 168/78, supposed to be on cozaar 50 mg BID, added HCTZ 25 mg QD. However, patient has only been taking cozaar 50 mg QD. Needed renewal of her prescription, was sent to medical walk in clinic prior to filling it, found BP to be 230/110. Had HA 2 nights ago lasting couple hours, posterior neck across top of head. While in waiting room also had HA, 4/10 from back of neck across top of head. No other sx - no CP, SOB, visual changes, abdominal pain, unilateral weakness, numbness, hematuria. Was stressed out over argument with granddaughter yesterday. In ED afebrile T 96.5, BP 235/92, HR 91, RR 18. No evidence papilledema, no focal neurologic signs. EKG with new TWI V1-V4, head CT and CXR unremarkable. Given hydralazine 10 mg IV x 2, ativan 1 mg IV x1, and lopressor 25 mg PO x1, BP improved to 160's/80's.
ROS: No F/C/NS. No change in weight/appetite. No CP/Palpitations/Orthopnea/PND/LE edema/Claudication. No SOB/cough/hemoptysis/wheezing/sore throat/rash. No N/V/D/hematochezia/melena. No delta MS/LOC. No slurring of speech, unilateral weakness. No dysuria. + Right heel pain since jumping to grab her dog 2 weeks ago. Otherwise negative in detail.
PMH:
HTN
DM2 - x 5 yrs, no retinopathy, nephropathy, neuropathy, HBA1C 7.2 7/26
RCC s/p right radical nephrectomy 2079, 4 cm, grade II/IV, confined in capsule
S/p colonoscopic polypectomy tubular adenoma 2079
Diverticulosis
Osteoporosis
Medications:
Cozaar 50 mg PO BID (only taking 50 QD)
HCTZ 25 mg PO QD (added 9/82, not taking)
Glyburide 5 mg PO QD
Premarin PO QHS (not taking)
Fosamax 70 mg PO QWK (not taking)
Ativan 0.5 mg PO QD PRN
Tums
MVI
Allergies: PCN, sulfa rash, ACE-I cough, codeine GI upset
SH: Patient lives in Marianna with husband of 54 yrs. Used to work at Filenesas a salesperson. Son handicapped after hit by drunk driver 9 yrs ago, this remains a significant stressor for her.
Tob: Very rare, quit 30 yrs ago
EtOH: Used to drink occasional glass wine, none recently
Illicits: Negative
FH: No MI, cancer. Brother with poor circulation .
Exam: VS: T= 98.2 HR= 68 BP= 152/81 RR= 18
General: NAD, well appearing
HEENT: NC/AT, PERRL, anicteric. EOMI. Fundi poorly visualized. OP w/ MMM, no erythema or injection.
Skin: No rashes
Neck: Supple, full ROM, no JVD , 2+ carotids w/o bruits, no thyromegaly or nodules, no nodes
Chest: CTA&P bilaterally
CVS: RRR nl S1 S2, no m/r/g
Abd: nl BS, soft, non-tender, no HSM, no abdominal bruits
Extr: no c/c/e 2+ DP's bilaterally
Neuro: AAOX3, MS nl, CN II through XII intact, Motor 5/5 UE and LE, Sensory intact to LT, vibration sense distally. F to N nl, RAM nl.
DATA:
Chemistry:

Heme:

DIFFERENTIAL REQUEST RECEIVED

Urinalysis:
Pending
Microbiology:
None
CXR:
Official read pending, no infiltrates, CHF
Head CT:
FINDINGS:
Dystrophic calcification in the basal ganglia bilaterally. Head
CT otherwise negative. No intracranial hemorrhage, mass, mass
effect, or edema. No gross evidence of acute infarction, although
MRI with diffusion weighted imaging would be more sensitive.
Intracranial arterial calcification. Bilateral lens implants.
IMPRESSION:
Essentially normal head CT.
EKG:
NSR 90 BPM, nl intervals, nl axis, deepening of old TWI aVL, new TWI V1-V4, isolated q in III
___________________________________________
Impression: 75 yo F with HTN, DM2, RCC s/p right radical nephrectomy 2079 presents with hypertensive urgency. Not taking all of prescribed meds. Could have left sided renal artery stenosis exacerbating HTN in setting of unilateral kidney, K is elevated, although Cr normal on cozaar. Needs tight BP control esp in setting of DM to prevent nephrosclerosis.
Plan:
HTN - BP now better controlled, cont to cycle q1 hr for now. Will repeat EKG, ROMI with serial cardiac enzymes. ASA, monitor. Cont cozaar 50 mg qd (may need to d/c or decrease dose if K remains elevated) and start lopressor 25 TID and titrate up as needed for BP control. Will not attempt to lower BP beyond 150-160's for now to prevent drop in cerebral perfusion pressure. Cont ativan 0.5-1 mg PO BID PRN. Consider MRI/MRA to assess for RAS given such severe BP elevation. Strict I/O's.
F/E/N - Kayexalate 30g x 1, recheck K in AM, consider lasix.
DM - Cont glyburide, check QID FS with insulin SS. Diabetic diet
Proph - Nexium, SC heparin
_________________________________
Xander H. Leonard, MD
Pager #77615
